value.verse: O God, why have you utterly cast us off? *
value.halfverse: why is your wrath so hot against the sheep of your pasture?

the tribe you redeemed to be your inheritance,
 and Mount Zion where you dwell.
value.verse: Remember your congregation that you purchased long ago, *

value.halfverse: the enemy has laid waste everything in your sanctuary.
value.verse: Turn your steps toward the endless ruins; *

value.halfverse: they set up their banners as tokens of victory.
value.verse: Your adversaries roared in your holy place; *

value.halfverse: they broke down all your carved work with hatchets and hammers.
value.verse: They were like men coming up with axes to a grove of trees; *
They set fire to your holy place; *
value.halfverse:
they defiled the dwelling-place of your Name
 and razed it to the ground.
They burned down all the meeting-places of God in the land.
value.verse: They said to themselves, “Let us destroy them altogether.” *

There are no signs for us to see;
there is no prophet left; *
value.halfverse: there is not one among us who knows how long.

value.verse: How long, O God, will the adversary scoff? *
value.halfverse: will the enemy blaspheme your Name for ever?

value.verse: Why do you draw back your hand? *
value.halfverse: why is your right hand hidden in your bosom?

value.verse: Yet God is my King from ancient times, *
value.halfverse: victorious in the midst of the earth.
and shattered the heads of the dragons upon the waters;
value.verse: You divided the sea by your might *
You crushed the heads of Leviathan *
value.halfverse: and gave him to the people of the desert for food.

value.verse: You split open spring and torrent; *
value.halfverse: you dried up ever-flowing rivers.
you established the moon and the sun.
value.verse: Yours is the day, yours also the night; *
You fixed all the boundaries of the earth; *
value.halfverse: you made both summer and winter.

value.verse: Remember, O LORD, how the enemy scoffed, *
value.halfverse: how a foolish people despised your Name.
never forget the lives of your poor.
value.verse: Do not hand over the life of your dove to wild beasts; *
Look upon your covenant; *
value.halfverse: the dark places of the earth are haunts of violence.
let the poor and needy praise your Name.
value.verse: Let not the oppressed turn away ashamed; *

value.halfverse: remember how fools revile you all day long.
value.verse: Arise, O God, maintain your cause; *
Forget not the clamor of your adversaries, *
value.halfverse: the unending tumult of those who rise up against you.
